tp:taxon-treatment.tp:nomenclature: Genus Esfahanites Korn & Hairapetian gen. nov.

tp:treatment-sec.p: Esfahanites armatus Korn & Hairapetian gen. et sp. nov. , Baghuk Mountain.

Representative of the family Dzhulfitidae with large conch; maximum adult diameters about 120 mm . Adult stage with trapezoidal whorl profile. Subadult stage with conical ventrolateral nodes, adult stage with weak ribs. Suture line with very small external lobe reaching only half the depth of adventive lobe.
Named after the city of Esfahan .
Esfahanites armatus Korn & Hairapetian gen. et sp. nov.
Esfahanites gen. nov. differs from Paratirolites and related genera in the very small external lobe.
